result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason J Lindekugel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in court with attorney Michael Scarantino.  Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing hearing on August 10, 2017 at 03:15 pm.
Exhibit 1-16 - All exhibits located in locked filing cabinet
Jury Question
Random Listing Report - Case
Counts 1, 2 and 3

8:45 a.m. Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in court with attorney Michael Scarantino.  Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in custody, in civilian clothes.   Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Motions in Limine are addressed from 7/27/17, 9 motions.  Attorney Grode changes the information wording on the record to controlled substance.  Attorney Scarantino objects.  Court denies objection and grants information wording.   Court takes plea on Ct. 3.  2nd motion in Limine addressed.  
9:10  Jury in Court, oath to jurors.  Court address the jurors in the box with a review of the case.  Court introduces Attorney Grode.  Attorney Scarantino introduces himself and the defendant to the jurors.  
9:16 a.m.  Voir Dire begins.  Court questions, excuses juror #943
9:22 a.m.  Attorney Grode commences with Voir Dire   Court excuses juror #948.  
9:39 a.m.  Attorney Scarantino commences with Voir Dire.  Court excuses juror #939 for cause.  
9:57 a.m.  Counsel commence strikes and Court instructs jury.
10:05 a.m. 12 Jurors are sworn in and seated. 
10:06 a.m.  Attorney Grode commences with opening statements.  
10:13 a.m.  Attorney Scarantino commences with opening statements.   
10:19 a.m.  Jury is excused for break, Court recesses for 10 minutes
10:35 a.m.  Court resumes.  Officer Libby Abel is sworn as witness and testifies to her employment with the City of Marshfield Police Department.  Testifies to her education and experience with operating while intoxicated.  Testifies to the events of 1/6/16 involving the defendant.  Exhibit 1, photo of intersection is entered and received.  The witness identifies the defendant in Court and Court recognizes.  Testifies to what she notice when she had her first contact with the defendant on that day.  Video is played and reviewed with the witness.   Exhibit 2, video, entered and received  Testifies to the tests given to the defendant for field sobriety. Testifies to results of the tests.    Exhibit 2, video is reviewed again.  Testifies to why she placed the defendant under arrest.  Testifies to what she did following the arrest, the search to the vehicle.  Witness testifies to the exhibits and why they are packaged the way they are.  Exhibit 4, glass container.  Exhibit glass pipe.  Exhibit 5, marijuana.  Exhibits 3,4, & 5 are entered and received.  Exhibit 6, informing the accused.  Exhibit 7, blood analysis  Exhibit 6 is entered and received
11:26 a.m.  Cross examination by Attorney Scarantino.  Testifies to the defendant being in control of the vehicle.  Testifies to how the defendant answered the questioned asked.  Testifies to the field sobriety test administered and how they were administered.  Exhibit 2 video is played and the witness testifies to the test given in question.  Testifies to the blood taken and the procedure for blood being sent for testing.  Testifies to exhibit 7 and when the blood is received.  Exhibit 8 is entered and reviewed with the witness.  Exhibit 8 received  Exhibit 9, evidence log, entered and received.  Testifies to what she believes was a typographical  error regarding weight of the marijuana.  
11:54 a.m.  Re direct Attorney Grode.  12:00 p.m.  recross from Attorney Scarantino
12:00 Court breaks for lunch and to resume at 1:00 p.m.
1:07 p.m.  Court reconvenes from lunch, jury returns.  Nicole Gaulke is sworn as witness and testifies to her employment at the Marshfield Clinic as a phelbonimist.  Testifies to the procedure for drawing blood at the emergency room for OWI's.  Testifies to exhibit 7.   Cross examination by Attorney Scarantino.  Testifies to not remembering taking the blood draw for this case.  Testifies to handing over the blood to the officer once it is taken.  Amy Goedert is sworn as witness and testifies to working for the State Crime Lab and her degrees.  Exhibit 10, lab findings.  Testifies to testing blood samples for restricted controlled substances.  Testifying to when it was received and tested.  Testifies to how it's stored before testing.  Testifies that the blood test is accurate  Exhibit 10 is entered and received  Re Direct from Attorney Scarantino  Exhibit 11 is entered and reviewed, lab findings. Exhibit 11 is received  Exhibit 7 is testified to by the witness.  Re cross from Attorney Grode.  Re -direct, Attorney Scarantino  Exhibit is received.  Michelle Fechhelm is sworn as witness and testifies to her former name.  Testifies to working for Wausau Crime Labs  Testifies to exhibit #5.  Testifies that she did the testing on exhibit 5.   Exhibit 12 is entered, lab findings.  Testifies to how things are received and marked.  Testifies to how she tested exhibit 5.    Exhibit 12 is received.  Re direct from Attorney Scarantino.  Testifies to how often she has testifies and for whom.  Exhibit 13 receipt,  is entered and received.   Exhibit 14 is entered, corrected receipt for evidence.  Re cross from Attorney Grode   Testifies to how reports are checked.  
1:56 p.m.  Jury excused for recess.  Attorney Scaratino moves for a directive verdict.  Court denies the motion to all counts. 
2:15 p.m.  Court reconvenes without the jury.  Attorney Scarantino states that the defendant will not be testifying.  Court reviews this decision with the defendant.  2:22 p.m. Court breaks 
2:26 p.m.  Court back on the record without the jury.   Court reviews jury instructions with the attorneys.    Verdicts are reviewed.  
2:33 p.m.  Jury reconvenes  Attorney Scarantino recalls Officer Abel.  Exhibit 2 is reviewed with the witness.  Exhibits 15 & 16 are entered and received, photos of roadway.  Cross examination by Attorney Grode.  
2:42 p.m.  Final instructions by the Court to the jury.   2:45 p.m.  Side Bar with attorneys.  2:46 p.m.  Attorneys return and instructions continues. 
3:02 p.m.  Close arguments from Attorney Grode.   
3:19 p.m.  Atty Scarantino requests a brief recess to discuss something on the record prior to his closing argument.  Jury recesses.  Atty Scarantino addresses instruction that was read and wishes to confer with his client.  Court believes it is a non prejudicial error.  Atty Scarantino confers with his client and moves for a mistrial.  Court denies the motion based on felony offense for bail jumping.  Atty Grode indicates that the wording was in the instruction and may have been invited error.  Court so notes. 
3:27 p.m. Jury reconvenes.  Atty Scarantino offers closing arguments.  
3:45 p.m. Rebuttal argument by Atty Grode.  
3:55 Charge to the Jury.  4:00 Oath to Bailiffs Jean and Gary. 4:01 Jury deliberates.  Atty Grode asks court if he plans to address the sidebar.  Court reiterates previous discussions.  Exhibits not to go back unless asked for by jury and discussed by court.  4:02 Court recesses.  
5:55 p.m. Court reconvenes to take up question from the jury.  Court reads question on location of the THC.  Counsel agrees to have the jury brought back in and advised to rely on the testimony.  5:58 pm jury is brought in and Court advises the jurors that the evidence is closed and that they have to rely on their recollection.  6:00 Jury returns to deliberation.  
6:54 pm Jury returns from deliberation.  Verdict is provided to the Court by Foreperson #954 and read as follows:

16CF502 - Not Guilty of OWI of Controlled Substance.  Count 2 - Guilty of Oper w/Restriced Controlled Substance.
16CF12 Ct 1 - Guilty of Poss THC.  Ct 2 - Guilty Bail Jumping, Ct 3 - Guilty of Poss Drug Para

Court polls the jurors individually.  All had the same verdicts.  Court advises jurors of their next reporting date and excuses the jurors.  Atty Grode moves court for judgment according to verdicts.  Atty Scaratino moves the court for directed verdict.  Court denies.  Court and counsel agree to put off sentencing until a later date this week.
States Jury Instruction Checklist
Defendant's Second Set of Motions in Limine

Motion Hearing 7/28/2017
Denise Zamow

10:47 a.m. Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in court with attorney Michael Scarantino.  Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Testimony for  16CF12 and 16CF502.  Officer Libby Abel is sworn as witness and testifies to being a police officer for the City of Marshfield.  Testifies to the contact with the defendant on 1/6/16.  The witness identifies the defendant in courtroom and the Court recognizes.  Testifies to what she observed and smelled at the traffic stop.  Testifies to the tests she administered.  Testifies to the training she's had regarding the different type of tests she administered.  Testifies to putting the defendant under arrest and what she found in his vehicle.  Cross examination by Attorney Scarantino.  Testifies to how she administers the tests.  The recording of the tests is played.  Testifies to the recording.   Re direct from Attorney Grode.  Re cross from Attorney Scarantino.  The witness reviews the rules of the roads which are provided by Attorney Scarantino.  Court breaks  11:25 a.m.   Court reconvenes.  11:39 a.m.  The witness testifies to the statue she used for the traffic stop.  Testifies to her interpretation of the statue.  Testifies to the turn the defendant made.  Re direct from Attorney Grode.  Testifies to the turn
Defense calls Scott Brehm and he is sworn as witness and testifies to being private investigator.  Testifies to his professional background and experience.  Testifies to his investigation regarding this case.  Testifies to his opinion on whether the tests were performed correctly.  Cross examination by Attorney Grode.  Testifies to his certifications and when he was certified to perform field sobriety tests.  Court will hear arguments today.  Attorney Grode argues against the motion to suppress.  Attorney Scarantino argues for his motion.  Court denies the motion.
Defendant's First Set of Motions in Limine
Jury trial - 12 person on August 8, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Motion hearing on July 28, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in court with attorney Michael Scarantino.  Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has filed a motion to adjourn and motion to suppress.  Attorney Scarantino makes a statement. Court adjourns.  Court further schedules the sentencing on the other pending cases for July 20, 2017.  The motions will be heard on that date as well.
Motion hearing on July 20, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Jury trial - 12 person on March 7, 2017 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in court with attorney Richard E. Bender.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Grode brings a motion to join cases 16CF12 and 16CF502.  Attorney Bender does not oppose. Court grants.

Attorney Bender makes a statement regarding rescheduling the jury on these cases.  Court will not reschedule the jury trial.  Court discusses negotiation fairness with Attorney Grode and advises him to let Attorney Bender know what his offer will be.

Defendant Jason J Lindekugel in court with attorney Richard E. Bender.  Danuta E. Kurczewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Officer Abel sworn in.  Testifies she is an officer with the Marshfield Police Department. Testifies she initiated a traffic stop involving the defendant.  Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. Testifies she performed field sobriety tests with the defendant. Testifies she did search vehicle after arrest. 
Cross by Attorney Bender. Testifies to location of traffic stop. Testifies she confirmed the defendant's license was revoked at the time of traffic stop. 
Attorney Kurczewski asks court to take judicial notice of 13CF274 and 08CF117. Court takes judicial notice. 
Probable cause found.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
